subject: RE: [junit] GUI Testing problem plz help
msgSnippet: Does anyone out there actually use Abbot? I had tried it over a year ago and found it too flaky and buggy to actually seriously use.  We tried it again last
messageBody:
Does anyone out there actually use Abbot?

I had tried it over a year ago and found it too flaky and buggy to actually seriously use. We tried it again last week and still had nothing but problems with it. It has so much potential but I just can't seem to make it perform as advertised.

John

-----Original Message-----
From: Timothy Wall [mailto:twall@...]
Sent: Thursday, April 29, 2004 5:55 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] GUI Testing problem plz help


invoke the dialog "show" on a different thread from your main test
thread.

the abbot framework (abbot.sf.net) provides a junit TestCase extension
with facilities to aid in doing this sort of thing regularly.

On Apr 7, 2004, at 1:23 AM, Jagdish Rao wrote:

> hello all
>
> hi i'm jagdish n i'm new to java development so dont get annoyed
> if i'm asking something silly
>
> The Prob : I have a swing based GUI class called LoginView which is a
> typical login screen.i have written test cases to test the variuos
> conditions
> such as blank username and password or incorrect password.
>
> for this in my loginview class i am using the Joptionpane to display
> the
> alerts to user such as please enter data or incorrect password.
>
> now here when i run my test case the execution stops for the user to
> respond to Joptionpane.this is the problem
>
> i want to pass ok click to the test case(Incorrect password) so that
> testing wont require user intervention.
>
> please guide me if it is possible as i know it is a modal window(i
> guess its not possible)
> and if not plz suggest me some coding architecture change in the test
> case design or workaround
> or any other better way to achieve this
>
> and if there r any other tools for these kinda GUI testing please
> suggest some of them.
>
>
> i am also pasting some code 4 ur reference
>
> thx in adv
> cheers
> jag
>

> the Test case

> public void testOKButtonWithLoginWithoutPassword()
> {
> MockKesslerHandle mAction = new MockKesslerHandle();
> LoginView mView = new LoginView(mAction, null);
>
